description: Application under Section 73 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 to carry out development without compliance with Condition 1 (Approved Plans) of Planning Permission ref 20/00415/HOU (Erection of double storey side and rear extension, loft conversion with 3no dormer windows and addition of Juliet balcony to front elevation) to allow for the following changes to size of extensions, changes to fenestration and internal alterations
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: As required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

The facing materials to be used in the construction of the building shall be those specified on the application form and approved drawings or such other materials as have been approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced and shall thereafter be retained as such.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking or reenacting this Order) no windows or other openings (other than those hereby approved) shall be formed in the flank walls of the extension hereby approved without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To protect the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of the adjoining residential properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments, including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Detailed drawings at the scale of 1:50 of the side facing window to the stairwell on the northern side elevation shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the relevant part of work is begun. Specification details (to include, colour, thickness, etc) of the intended opaque glazing shall also be submitted to the Local Planning Authority. The details thereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with that approval in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments, including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012. Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
The proposed site is in a flood zone, therefore please submit 'Flood Risk Form/Statement'.
Please submit 'Fire Statement/Plan'. If you consider the proposal does not require fire statement, please submit 'Reasonable Exception Statement.'
For the avoidance of doubt, please confirm the description 'Erection of single storey side and rear, first floor rear extension'.

All applications that involve extensions must provide "45 Degree" floor and elevation plans. These should be drawn at a scale of 1:50 or 1:100, they should accurately identify neighbouring building(s) and window(s) and when possible indicate the use of the room served by the window(s), and should be annotated to show the application of the 45 degree 'rule'. Please see the Householder Validation Local List for more information.
